title: Delicious, but poor shipping methods
review: Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snacks are delicious.  I crave them the way most people crave potato chips.  They're low in calories (60 calories for the entire package) and contain beneficial minerals that you might not get elsewhere, so you can eat a ton of them without feeling guilty.  It's an excellent product.The problem was that these were shipped in a bag, not a box.  This would be fine if the plastic box inside the wrapping were rigid, but it's not.  Every box was flattened at some point during shipping.  Seaweed snacks don't really bend without breaking.  Everything was broken into little shards that drifted around the inside of the package during shipping, so when I went to open one of the packages, the seaweed on the outside of its container got all over the place.  Since these are made with oil, it's very hard to get little bits off of a surface.  Eating them without making a mess was equally difficult.  You'd think for $5 shipping the sellers would at least make sure the product made it to the buyer in one piece.  I wish they had taken the care to use a box rather than a bag.  What I really wish was that I'd just made the trip to Trader Joe's and bought them there.  I'm very disappointed.
author: Caroline

title: Satisfying Salty Sea Snack
review: This salty, savory gem is so satisfying.  Packaged in an airtight container, it is as fresh and crisp as the moment it was packed at the factory.  Each package has only 60 calories--and that's for two servings!  The seaweed comes in thin, rectangular sheets of a beautiful shade of green.  As you take a bite, the crisp sheet reminds you of biting into a potato chip or popcorn--crunch and a bit of salt.  Once on your tongue, it begins to dissolve, giving you a more gelatinous texture.  If you enjoy Japanese foods such as sushi, this is for you.What a great, low calorie alternative to take to the movies.  Or, to lunch, to eat at your desk, in the car, at sports events, on the plane.  Easy to handle, small, crunchy, salty, chewy.  M-m-m, just plain yummy.

title: Not A Healthy Snack
review: I love roasted seaweed snacks. I have purchased these directly from a Trader Joe's store. This brand is on the bland and flimsy side of the seaweed snack spectrum, but they are tasty enough. The upside of seaweed snacks for me is the iodine content. If you've never tried seaweed snacks before, they may be an acquired taste. The downside is that they are made with canola oil which is unhealthy because it inhibits enzyme function among other effects. There are other brands which are canola-free. Had these been canola-free, I could only wish that the people who dumped theirs in the trash would have sent them my way. Based on that fact that there are seaweed snacks with healthier ingredients, I won't be buying these again. In fact, I will try making them at home with a recipe found in my search for canola-free snacks. If you do eat these, you may experience digestive upsets if you consume more than a few at a time. I don't know if it's because of the canola oil or if it's seaweed-related, but this seems to be a common side effect.
author: Skayea

title: Great for hypothyroid .. DOES NOT contribute to acne & Good price & Taste great
review: At first I gave this a low-rating, since I thought it contributed to my kid's acne.  After 1 year of using this, I upgrade to 5-stars. This product also has 8% vitamin A (helps with skin & thyroid), plus 20% vitamin C, and 2% iron.  One pack has only 30 calories, and only 99 cents at Trader's Joe.I notice that I nap easier when I snack on this for breakfast.  I appreciate this product for is low-cost, low-calories, and how it helps my teenager daughter with her hypothyroid .. her skin is clear, despite having one pack per day. title: Surprisingly...Awesome!
review: I'm no vegetarian, and am certainly not a "granola girl," yet I find these so amazingly tasty! There's just a moderately salty crunch at first, and then they basically "melt in your mouth." The flavor is exactly like the seaweed wrapped around sushi rolls; no "fishy" taste.Like other reviewers, I initially decided to try these because (1) they're crazy-low in calories, and (2) I'd heard about how healthy seaweed is. So glad I did! These - remarkably - satisfy my husband's salty-crunchy cravings, so we don't buy any potato chips/tortilla chips/pretzels/popcorn anymore!I really wanted to dock a star for (1) wanting to eat more than are in each package (aka: the package is too small), and (2) because they're pretty pricey compared to other salty-crunchy snacks. But, I just couldn't do it. They are too darn delicious! I would buy these in bulk at Sam's Club if I could!Side note: I haven't done any research on the health benefits of dried v. fresh seaweed. I suspect that fresh has many more vitamins/nutrients, but that's purely my own speculation. If anyone has any info on this...please comment on my review so I can take a look. Thanks!

title: Addictive and delicious!
review: This review is going to sound very different from a normal one.First off, I would like to point out that yes, I gave it four stars on purpose.  Please keep that in mind and read this very thoroughly.I hate these snacks.  I hate them because they are so insanely addictive, I find it nearly impossible to "just have one."  Invariably, I end up consuming the entire package grinning like a giddy schoolchild.  Even if I put them away, I will inevitably find myself searching the package out, just so I can have one more.. and then again, and again, until the package is finally empty, and then I am sad.I hate them because of their fun, paper-thin texture, which makes it seem like you've some piece of unique candy, then it turns out to be a delicious, slightly salty, somewhat chewy snack which makes your brain scream 'Oooh, yay, SUSHI!' only for it to suddenly turn nutty in a twist which makes me want to have just one more to experience that fun crinkle of the sheets (for they are super-thin sheets of dried, roasted seaweed), the YAY of incoming sushi, that slightly chewy transformation, and then they dissolve into almost nothingness, leaving you reaching for another one.I hate them because the pack lasts about 45 minutes.  An hour and a half, if I'm demonstrating exceptionally strong willpower for the day.  Possibly longer if I can manage to convince someone *else* to hide them from me.I hate them because said pack gives me 40% of my Vitamin C for the day in less than half an ounce of actual dried seaweed.  And something that tastes so very delicious isn't supposed to be that healthy.  Bacon doesn't give vitamin C.  These snacks do.  That's confusing.  Snacks are supposed to be guilty pleasures, not delightful dietary supplements.I hate them because the only physical store that carries them in my area is Trader Joe's, and I always end up opening the pack after they are closed.  So when the package is empty and I am sad, I must wait until morning to "get my fix" again.I hate them because I ate an entire package while writing this review.  And now it is gone.  And now I am sad.  Thankfully, though, I can get them here and have them delivered to my door.  I might have to order a few of the six packs, though, to last me until the next order I place can arrive.  I'm working out a rationing calendar that I probably won't stick to for more than an hour.And finally, I hate that I don't hate these at all, but am hopelessly and utterly addicted to them.  Seaweed Anonymous, thou art my name.
author: Amazon Customer

title: It tastes like bay water.
review: I received a package of Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack for my 23rd birthday. Growing up deeply entrenched in Asian cuisine, I knew before trying it that it was more than likely not going to be to my tastes. If you like products such as grass jelly or sushi, or anything that is pungent and tastes like plant material without being om nom nom delicious, this is for you.This product is not recommended for small children. There's not enough sugar in it.This product is also not recommended for vegans and seliacs. While it is gluten free and animal-product free, you can do something better for yourselves by finding an alternative snack without the bay water flavor.This product is not recommended for people with heart disease or who are at risk for developing heart disease. It's a high sodium choice.This product is not recommended for alcoholics. You'll start drinking again.This product is not recommended for cigarette smokers. Save your money for your cancer sticks.This product IS recommended for users of Mountain Dew, grass or ai ju jelly, pickled radish, bean thread, sushi, menudo, mole sauce, adobo sauce, specialty bell peppers, bouncy balls, pencil and pen erasers, rubber soles, rubber in general, motor oil, gasoline/petrol, radioactive isotopes, unidentified rare earth metals, tapeworms, Buffalo Bills fans, fruit cake, Hostess snacks, corn, rat, and/or chicken snakes, parents of teenagers (for use as a punishment agent on those late night sneak outs), water bottles, organic milk, Tuscan Whole Milk, Three Wolf Moon shirts, wolf shirts in general, Twilight readers, and insomniacs.The flavor matches wonderfully with a fresh whole rabbit, such as the one listed on this site.I would rate it higher than two stars in the regards that it's a wonderful seaweed product. However, I don't like it. That's the definition of two stars.
author: Proofs and Truths

title: Needs More Heat
review: Firstly, they have an odd taste.  I'm not sure how to describe it other than kind of earthy and vegetable at the same time.  I found that off putting.The crackers themselves are good.  They need more flavor, though.  My eyes barely watered and my nose was relatively dry when eating these.  I'm looking for a sinus flush reaction!  When I found clusters of crackers I got the one-two punch effect, but it dissipated quickly.  My husband could tell when I was eating these because they had an odor.  Our office is 37 feet long and I am behind a hutch.  He could smell them as he was coming up the stairs, which are across the room from my desk.  He would say, "damnit, baby, are you eating Those Things again?!"  I would proudly smile and stuff another handful in my mouth as I nodded emphatically.  :DThe best thing about these - no Peas!  I never had to worry about cracking a tooth on a cracker that was denser than it was supposed to be and that's a big bonus.  Sometimes those peas are like stones!Unfortunately that flavor I can't quite describe was too detrimental and I can't bring myself to order more.  The search continues for a snack that will make me cry and clear my sinuses.

I decided to try these after reading other reviews about the strong wasabi presence, and they were correct. I ate a small handful at once and it actually made me sneeze, which IMO is fantastic. title: All kinds of wrong, and absolutely addictive
review: Man, there is so much that is wrong with pork scratchings, and I love them for every single thing.First, this product is not at all the same as pork rinds as you know them in the States. If you buy pork scratchings thinking they are the same, you will be revolted. If - like me, when I first came here - you buy pork rinds thinking they are the same as pork scratchings, you will be depressed at the state of modern humanity.Both products are made from pigs, and both taste of pork. There the resemblance ends.Now, my memory is that these used to be called pork crackling back in the day, a traditional British snack that you bought in the pub with a beer, or loosely packed in plastic bags from old-school butchers. But everyone called them pork scratchings, and the manufacturers fell into line some time ago.You do not want to think about why we called them pork scratchings, or about what they are, or what they look like. All you need to know is that they are delicious.What you get is a whole bunch of teeny, tiny packets of triple-fried pork skins. Little lumps of massive salted pork flavor from the skin and occasional flecks of meat, and supercharged umami from the generous coating of fat on each piece. In the butchers' version you could also sometimes find bonus treats like triple-fried hair or pig's nipple, but I've not found those here (shame!). It's the flavor, the umami, and the salt that you're buying here, and as I see it, in each teeny tiny packet you get twice as much flavor as in a big bag of US-style pork rinds. It's a bargain.To put it another way; you know those roasted seaweed snacks you can get from Korea? Healthy, delicate and nicely balanced whispers that melt in your mouth? British pork scratchings are the precise opposite of that.Have I mentioned the crunch? It's a great crunch. So good in fact, and so strong, that you won't even notice if you break a tooth when biting down. (Which was a distinct risk when eating pork scratchings back in the day. They seem to have pulled back a bit on the modern crunch. I blame dentists for that.)I love them and you will too (I'm assuming you're not a vegetarian if you're reading this review).You have been warned.
author: m b

title: You've found them. Your quest is finally over.
review: I know why you're here. You're looking for cracklings. Not pork rinds; cracklings. Pork rinds don't compare once you've gotten the itch. You've tasted the exquisite masterpiece that is the belly and still yearn; each piece deep fried until the fat has turned into a crisp honeycomb of bacon-like ecstacy, ensconced within the crunch of flavor-packed skin. Go no further, the great swine god has passed his favor upon you today. You've found sheer pork nirvana.

title: Savory, Flavorful and Brings Back So Many Great Memories! Viva the UK!
review: My family was stationed in England via the USAF in the 1980's. We lived off base (what they called, "on the economy") and a block from a nice village pub. My dad would go every other Saturday night while me, my siblings, and my mom would have family movie night at home. My dad would ask all of us kids which pub snacks he wanted us to bring home. My choice was always pork scratchings. Sunday morning we would awake to see our treats laid out for us on the dining room table.Now, I live back in the USA and have tried so many different pork rinds, scratchings, etc but have yet to come across an authentically British version of these. The Mexican ones are close but still not the same. I'm so happy to have finally found some here on Amazon.Mr. Porky Pork Scratchings are the real deal!! Crunchy on the outside, chewy/soft inside and filled with lots of flavor. They are a tad on the salty side but they make for an excellent every-now-and-then snack.I told my dad about them and he's happily looking forward to me shipping some to him soon.I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a quality pork scratching. Whether you have memories from the UK or have never tried them and would like to give it a go, this is the brand I would recommend.
author: Nicole

title: The best tasting seaweed ever!
review: These seaweed snacks are a fantastic snack and the chipotle flavor provides just enough heat & flavor to make it interesting, without being overwhelming. I love the fact that I've replaced chips with seaweed snacks, as they are much healthier, and yet I hardly notice the difference because the flavor of these is so great. My only complaint is that these are pretty expensive and so I don't buy them regularly. Instead, I will typically buy the Kirkland brand seaweed because they give you a lot more for your money. The downside there is that they don't have Chipotle flavors like this, but I'm willing to dip them in my own hot sauce to accomplish that aim.Highly recommend any type of seaweed snack as a healthier alternative to chips & other traditional junk food...

title: Great introduction into what the kids eat on the other side of the world.
review: We bought ours from the seller AKIBA King and we were very pleased with the product. It arrived almost exactly (2 days less) than a month after purchase. The contents were varied and closely resembled what I had expected (from product pictures). There was an expiration date guide included. One item (one of the sticks in the top right of my photo) expired 2 days after arrival, so we ate that first (it was tasty). A few expire towards the end of this month, and the rest seem to expire around about 3 months from arrival with an outlier here or there. I haven't eaten all of them yet, but I will say from looking and being the type of person who has ordered quite a few of these Japanese candy/snack boxes that this isn't for the type of person who only wants to eat stereotypical American type of candy. This is for someone who wants to legitimately try snacks that another country would eat, including the wasabi seaweed type of flavors (one that was included in my pack).

title: Came a week early!
review: I was anticipating this package for the longest time, and when it came a week earlier than expected I was absolutely ecstatic! I'm Japanese and miss Japanese snacks but I live in a place where no one sells it nearby, so I'm glad such a thing like this exists. It's neatly packaged in a box and nothing appears to be cracked or smashed, and I'm actually quite happy with the fact some flavors are randomized! I will warn however that most of this isn't the popular Japanese food like Pocky, so if you're not used to the taste of Japanese snacks I recommend a package that has more conventional brands before moving onto packages like these. Finally, there's no English description in the box (at least for mine) for the flavors and ingredients, so keep that in mind if that would be an issue!

title: great seller! So I like most of the colors
review: I ordered my pack from Kolorize Me whom I also reviewed, great seller! So I like most of the colors. The metallics are gorgeous but not what I was expecting. They're not quite what I personally would call metallic. More like a very heavy pearl. Still gorgeous! But I'll have to look elsewhere for the perfect metallic polish. The neons are gorgeous and CRAZY BRIGHT! Not quite neon but the next tier of obnoxiously bright. The pastels are perfect! They remind me of Easter lol. The only one I didn't like that much was the purple. Well, I like it but I think it's too dark for pastel (very pale skin here). I also got the holo polishes that KC makes. I really love Chunky Holo Black the best (I think everyone does). The formula for these polishes doesn't really seem to be incredibly consistent. I played around with about 30 different colors already and can see that some of the polishes apply REALLY well and others don't. Meaning, some I could apply one coat and get away with. Others, I gave up at 3. The obvious ones are the holos, I know that already. But others like Neon Lime, Funky Yellow and Sheer Lilac were still pretty see through. For the purposes I need them for (Stamping and nail art), I'll have to mess around with each color individually to get a feel for it or else I wind up with splotchy nails that look like a mess. For the price you pay on this particular pack, it's a killer deal. I'd definitely recommend it for someone who is looking into playing around with a lot of color or is maybe a novice. The price = many chances to mess up and not worry. But if you're used to QUALITY nail polish, I'd steer clear of this. I attached a photo , please ignore the 6 in the middle and the lip gloss. Those aren't part of this review. :)
author: Mercury & Garrett

title: Quality Product and Quick Delivery
review: I just received my package last night. I am beyond thrilled with it. Kleancolor is a brand that I use almost exclusively. They were packaged in small boxes 6 to a box with a cardboard separator and a layer of bubble wrap to make it tight. The large box was the perfect size for the small boxes so there was no rattling around.I painted my nails last night the beautiful metalic red color. I love it. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is looking to be able to paint their nails in a variety of colors, frequently. I can't speak to the longevity of the polish as I change almost daily. But I definitely love the Kleancolor brand.

title: suspicious

title: Great, but ...
review: I have received 3 boxes, one monthly, with Subscribe & Save.  I would have given 5 stars, and this may be due to Amazon's packing, but about half of the crackers are broken into pieces that are so small you can only eat them with your fingers.  You cannot scoop dip or spread hummus on them because they are so small.  A good part of the pieces are so small they are actually crumbs.  It is really a shame because the crackers that survived the shipping are thin, very crispy and tasty.  I used to buy Mary's crackers from Costco, and the product was never as pulverized as the 3 boxes I have received.  The S&S price is really good, but not for crumbs.  I will be canceling further orders.
author: berdie1951
cleaned_text: received boxes monthly subscribe save given stars due amazon packing half crackers broken pieces small eat fingers cannot scoop dip spread hummus small part pieces small crumbs shame crackers survived shipping thin crispy tasty used buy mary crackers costco product never pulverized boxes received price crumbs canceling orders

review: I’ve tried this and the original seed variety. Read on about my negative experience with both:I have purchased at least ten+ boxes from Sprouts. They had a burnt flavor indicating they were left in the oven too long. I emailed the company to let them know. They said they’d send me coupons and never did. I followed up saying I hadn’t received them and they said sure we’ll send them off. Three weeks later nothing. I found good seed crackers at Trader Joe’s which don’t cost almost $6 a box and without concern of eating burnt crackers. I can’t believe I query in politely to let them know and they led me on, hence my decision to write a review. Seriously, without any exaggeration these are the worst crackers I’ve ever had the displeasure of tasting.

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: Well....I was very excited to try some of these products because I LOVE Asian food. Today I purchased the seaweed snacks and the ramen bowl. I was very eager to try it so I ripped it open as soon as I got into the car and put a piece into my mouth......And then I almost threw up immediately. I hate to sound dramatic but it's true. I'm not 100% sure if it was a texture thing or an actual taste thing but it was awful!! It took EVERYTHING in my power to not throw up in my car. I had to dig in my center console for a piece of gum to help get the taste out of my mouth. I am still looking forward to trying other products in this line, but the seaweed snacks are definitely not for me. I also purchased the wasabi flavor but I am TERRIFIED to try it. title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: Taste really good. Crispy and not too salty.Seaweed might not be the first thing that comes to mind when we think of healthy snacks, but it's actually a delicious, low-cal way to add a boost of nutrients to your day. It's packed with important vitamins and minerals such as iodine, calcium, iron, magnesium, zinc, and vitamins A and C. When you buy it in stores, you'll most often find dried seaweed (usually the nori variety, which is the kind used to wrap sushi) sold in sheets, flakes, or handy snack packs. Fresh seaweed, on the other hand, is commonly sold as an ingredient in prepared foods like sushi or seaweed salad. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

review: I couldn't decide what to do for dinner, and when I spotted the row of Ocean's Halo broths in my grocer's soup aisle I knew I had to give one a try. After some deliberation, (and input from the kids) I went with the Thai coconut flavor. I also picked up a box of Ocean's Halo rice noodles, chicken and some veggies to make soup.When I opened the carton and took a whiff I was met with the scents of thai spices and brine. It reminded me of my favorite thai restaurant. Following the instructions on the box, it took me less than ten minutes to throw together a delicious soup--the perfect meal for a frigid late fall evening. My entire family loved the taste, including my picky 6 year old. Win!I am looking forward to trying the other flavors of broth that Oceans Halo offers, as well as some of their other products. Overall, good product, especially for newbie sushi - makers! :)

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: This stuff is DELICIOUS!!! I really enjoyed Ocean's Halo Sea Salt Sea Weed Snacks. If you enjoy traditional seaweed, this is it. I've tried several brands and they all use WAY too much oil or the seaweed is too thick. This seaweed is perfectly thin and crumbly, salted and lightly seasoned. Ocean's Halo Seaweed is a bit different from the other seaweed. Ocean's Halo Seaweed is lightly roasted then lightly salted for an exquisite, healthy treat everyone in your family will love! Thanks to its many health benefits of seaweed, it is a staple in our home. Ocean's Halo is 100% natural premium seaweed in a convenient little package. Rich in trace minerals and vitamins. Great source of Iodine. No hassle-Ready to serve. Perfect size to carry in your bag for anytime snack. No Sugar, No Preservatives. No Cholesterol, No Trans Fat. Roasted and lightly salted with natural sea salt, it has a wonderful nutty flavor. One pouch would definitely be great for a rice bowl, salad or just a snack in between your day.

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: I recieved a coupon/voucher for a full size product of Ocean Halo's Seaweed Snacks & I tried out their chili lime flavor. It was pretty good in flavor. I don't regularly eat seaweed but when I do it's usually in sushi, like a veggie sushi. Seaweed on its own or unflavored seaweed is usually kind of bitter & has its own unique or "special" taste & could be described as an acquired taste. It usually is a bit more palatable when accompanied by other ingredients. I liked the chili lime seaweed because it has a mild & not too over seasoned flavor of both the chili & lime. I used my package to garnish some fish tacos that I made & it paired pleasantly well. I also crushed up a few & added them to a salad. Speaking for myself I liked the pairing of those two items I used the seaweed with. I didn't snack on the seaweed by itself as I don't eat it that regularly & by itself, flavored or unflavored, I'm not that fond of. It is a great tasting product for being seaweed & is packaged well. I don't think I will be buying it again as I don't regularly consume all that much seaweed as part of my diet. I would recommend it to someone who happens to enjoy it on a more consistent basis or I would pick it up sometime maybe down the line if I happen to be in the mood for something different than the usual snacks or food items I pick up. All in all it is a good product & I do recommend trying it if you're a sushi aficionado & like consuming it more regularly than a person such as myself.

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: As part of the social nature program I was able to sample Ocean's Halo seaweed snacks complimentary through their program. I sampled both the sea salt flavor as well as the bacon variety. I have been eating seaweed snacks since I was a little child, and it's definitely a favorite snack of mine. I thought that the Ocean's Halo seaweed snack in sea salt flavor was great. I liked the crispy, light texture of the seaweed sheets. However, the bacon flavor was not my favorite. Although I love bacon, when it is flavor infused into seaweed, it didn't really meet my expectations. I also felt that the bacon flavored seaweed variety was lacking the crispy texture that I enjoyed with the sea salt variety. Overall, I think that Ocean's Halo seaweed snacks are a great snack product. Personally, I would skip the unusual flavors, and choose the sea salt variety, which I found to have great texture and allowed the seaweed flavors to take center stage.

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: These were really yummy and make a healthy, low-calorie, alternative snack that fits easily in a lunch bag. My preferred way to eat them is rolled up with a little bit of cream cheese and slice of avocado. The Chili Lime and Wasabi flavors made this simple combination interesting and introduced some variety to my family's snacking options. They're also fantastic crunched up on top of rice bowls, ramen, scrambled eggs, and stir-fried veggies. The price point is pretty much on-par with other brands, however Ocean's Halo has the added benefit of being sustainable and non-GMO, which is very important to me. I'll definitely be a return customer! Such a great way to satisfy a craving for something salty and savory with minimal guilt!

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: I've tried this product before in a different flavor (Sriracha), this time I tried Sea Salt (it was the only flavor in stock at my local grocery and I'm starting to see why) and I have to say that the flavor that I just tried wasn't exactly great in my opinion. Sure, one should be expecting much from a flavor like Sea Salt when it applies to something like sea weed, but this was by far the saltiest sea weed I've ever tried! I drank over half a bottle of water and still felt parched! I don't recommend eating this on its own. Adding it to ramen or maybe some kind of rice bowl is fine, but if you try to eat it on its own, expect to be chugging down to get the saltiness out of your mouth. The sea weed is very pronounced and is constantly at odds with the equally powerful sea salt flavor. Try it if you dare.

title: Organic Seaweed Snacks Review
review: I redeemed the coupon for the Sushi Nori Full Seaweed Sheets, as the store I visited only had the Bacon and Sea Salt flavors available in the Seaweed Snacks and I wanted the Chili Lime flavor. I decided to try and make authentic sushi rice rolls, so I chose the full sheets. The packaging made it easy to find in the store and was relatively easy to open while remaining sturdy enough to protect the product. I was pleased with the number of seaweed sheets that came in the package and all of them were in good condition and were not dry or crumbly. When it came to the taste, I was not so pleased. I felt as though the sheets could use a lot more flavor. I offered a sheet to one of my coworkers, who also enjoys seaweed, and he felt similarly. It tasted fairly bland either by itself or with rice and filling, to the point where I had to add my own seasoning. Suggestions: I would have liked to see a vegan label on the Bacon variety, as the reason I passed it up was because I believed that animal products were used when that is not the case. It would also be nice to see the sushi nori sheets available in the same flavors as the snack sheets. I will likely try the seasoned varieties if I am able to find them in the store.
